wikipedia_page.main: Thomas Jack (5 February 1881 – 9 October 1961) was a British track and field athlete. He competed at the 1908 Summer Olympics.

link_mentions.page: Athletics at the 1908 Summer Olympics – Men's marathon
response: The official report lists the leaders at each mile from the fourth to the twenty-fourth: Thomas Jack (miles 4–5); Frederick Lord (miles 6–14); Charles Hefferon (miles 15–24). Dorando Pietri of Italy caught Hefferon and sped up between Old Oak Common Lane and Wormwood Scrubs.

link_mentions.page: Great Britain at the 1908 Summer Olympics

response: He was succeeded as chief of the N'quatqua or Anderson Lake Band of the St'at'imc by his son Thomas Jack, who led an unsuccessful campaign for redress for the gold of the Bridge River Country (40 million ounces of gold from the Bralorne mine alone).

We found William Jack was Deacon of the Church of Aberdeen in 1580, Thomas Jack was headmaster of Glasgow's Grammar School in 1574, and Andrew Jack lost his ship off Aberdeen in 1577. The name is more prevalent in Aberdeen in modern times.Swyrich Corporation, The Most Distinguished Surname Jack,1998
*Thomas Jack (1881–1961), British track and field athlete
Tom Jack Johnston, (better known by his stage name Thomas Jack) is an Australian DJ, record producer and musician. He is noted for the "tropical house" subgenre, and first coined the term in 2013.

Johnston refers to his summery, laid-back dance tracks as tropical house. Inspired by deep house as well as acoustic rock and jam bands, his tracks heavily feature live instruments, particularly saxophone, flute, piano, and guitar, and generally have a relaxed, sunny, uplifting feel. His tracks often feature samples of speeches. Speaking about his involvement in the genre, Johnston said "I just wanna be Thomas Jack and do my thing. I fear that, in a year, I'm gonna be jammed in this corner. And everyone's gonna know me as just that".

On 30 October 2015, Johnston released his debut single "Rivers" featuring Norwegian singers Nico & Vinz. The single peaked fourth on the Belgian chart, fifty-first on the Dutch chart and sixteenth on the Norwegian chart. On 26 November 2015, an official music video was uploaded to Thomas Jack's YouTube channel.
